name: Team and Professional Skills
overview: Version control is a way of keeping track of changes to files over time so that you can recall previous versions when needed and also easily work with other teammates collaboratively
objectives: Explain what version control is and why itâ€™s important
Differentiate between different version control systems
Use common git commands e.g. git init, status, add, commit, push, pull

name: Stack-Agnostic Technical Skills
overview: The technical skills covered under this section are those that cut across all language stacks. Understanding these skills well will set up for success in the subsequent sections.
objectives: Proper understanding of Data Structures and Algorithms
Introduction to the Functional Programming paradigm
Application of System Design knowledge to Sofware Development
Introduction to common software Design Patterns.

name: Ruby Fundamentals
overview: TDD is a software development process in which one writes tests before writing production code thus giving one an opportunity to think through a systems requirements.
objectives: How TDD beneficial is to programming

name: Ruby on Rails Fundamentals
overview: This module will cover the fundamentals of HTTP protocol and Web Services.
objectives: Understand the different HTTP verbs(e.g. PUT, POST)
Understand the meaning different HTTP status codes
Understand and explain RESTful API design

name: Ruby on Rails Capstone Project
overview: At Andela, we believe in Agile Software Development Methodology, and as such we try to live by its principles.
objectives: Explain the meaning of agile software development
Be familiar with tools used for agile software development
Understand how to use Pivotal Tracker
